div.p: S. Recently, I wrote to you about various matters; I thought Mr. Jacob Zorn would leave early today. However, he is still here today, which is why I want to inform you immediately about what was handled today. My lords, the schoolmasters, have come together.

Zebed√§us is being transferred to Yverdon, a measure and order for the colloquies has been prescribed, from which all discord has arisen so far, also 2 boys from Zurich are being transferred to Lausanne, as you will understand from the common letter. Today, after we came from each other, the man from Locarno arrives; I was with him at the governor's; he has summoned us for tomorrow for the council. I suspect that the messenger will be given instructions for the day in Baden.
Once it is completed, I will also write to Myconius and inform you how it went. God be with you. August 23.
You may also write to Myconius and Zwingli in the meantime. Johannes Haller.
To Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, preacher in Zurich.
